title: Shadow Cartography Uprising
outcome: Grassroots investigators uncover an old BCI mapping protocol showing neighborhoods deliberately starved of resources since Halden’s data centralization. Public anger grows as marginalized zones organize and demand reparations while the Council is forced into open negotiation and exposed for historic manipulations.

events.description: A group of grassroots data analysts leaks evidence of a hidden BCI map. It shows years of resource rationing targeted at low-score districts since Halden’s 2023 data centralization.
Neighborhoods named on the map stage coordinated blockades and refuse to cooperate with city authorities, demanding formal reparations and public negotiation.
A heated Council session erupts as records from Halden’s data edits reveal deliberate resource deprivation justified as 'efficiency.' Oksana Lintz is pressured to publicly address these decisions.
In response to organized disruption, the Council proposes a temporary redistribution plan. Protests escalate as citizens debate whether limited restitution is enough or if deeper reforms are needed.
